headline: Lam Research Is on a Roll. It Still Has Room to Climb, Analysts Say.
summary: The semiconductor-equipment market is heating up, and  Lam Research  is well positioned to benefit from the surge in demand, according to Deutsche Bank.  It raised its target for the stock price to $150 from $100 in a research note, arguing the company’s exposure to memory and leading-edge logic chips give it a solid platform for growth.  Wall Street has noticed increasing demand for wafer fabrication equipment, or WFE, in recent weeks, leading to upgrades and price-target hikes for Lam and competitors such as  Micron Technology  and  Applied Materials  Deutsche Bank projects total WFE sales will grow 6% this year and 5% in 2026, compared with earlier forecasts for 3% and 4%, respectively.

headline: Deutsche Bank bullish on Lam Research amid memory demand, its foundry exposure
summary: Investing.com -- Deutsche Bank upgraded Lam Research to Buy, saying better conditions in the memory chip market and increasing exposure to advanced foundry spending could help the semiconductor equipment maker outperform rivals over the next year.
